item.name: AppFirewall Requests Returning HTTP 4xx (delta)
item.description: Number of requests returning HTTP 4xx from the backend server

item.name: AppFirewall Requests Returning HTTP 5xx (delta)
item.description: Number of requests returning HTTP 5xx from the backend server

item.name: AppFirewall Violations (delta)
item.description: Total number of security check violations seen by the Application Firewall. Delta = difference from last to actual value.

item.name: AppFirewall Requests (delta)
item.description: HTTP/HTTPS requests sent to your protected web servers via the Application Firewall.

item.name: AppFirewall Responses (delta)
item.description: HTTP/HTTPS responses sent by your protected web servers via the Application Firewall.

item.name: HA node state
item.description: State of the node, based on its health, in a high availability setup. Possible values are: UP  Indicates that the node is accessible and can function as either a primary or secondary node. DISABLED  Indicates that the high availability status of the node has been manually disabled. Synchronization and propagation cannot take place between the peer nodes. INIT  Indicates that the node is in the process of becoming part of the high availability configuration. PARTIALFAIL  Indicates that one of the high availability monitored interfaces has failed because of a card or link failure. This state triggers a failover. COMPLETEFAIL  Indicates that all the interfaces of the node are unusable, because the interfaces on which high availability monitoring is enabled are not connected or are manually disabled. This state triggers a failover. DUMB  Indicates that the node is in listening mode. It does not participate in high availability transitions or transfer configuration from the peer node. This is a configured value, not a statistic. PARTIALFAILSSL  Indicates that the SSL card has failed. This state triggers a failover. ROUTEMONITORFAIL  Indicates that the route monitor has failed. This state triggers a failover.

item.name: HA enabled
item.description: Indicates whether a NetScaler is set up for high availability. Possible values are YES and NO. If the value is NO, the high availability statistics below are invalid.

item.name: HA master disputes
item.description: Number of HA master disputes.

item.name: Memory allocation failures while sending heartbeats
item.description: Total number of times memory allocation failed while sending heartbeats.

item.name: Heartbeat packets missed
item.description: Total number of times heartbeat packets were not received on any enabled interface for the duration of the Dead Interval.

item.name: Memory allocation failures during command propagation
item.description: Total number of times memory allocation failed during command propagation.

item.name: Number of times propagation timed out
item.description: Number of times propagation timed out.

item.name: Sync errors since last transition
item.description: Number of times the configuration of the primary and secondary nodes failed to synchronize since that last transition. A synchronization failure results in mismatched configuration. It can be caused by a mismatch in the Remote Procedural Call (RPC) password on the two nodes forming the high availability pair.

item.name: State transition reason (last)
item.description: The reason for the last master state transition. This gives the conditions under which this node assumed the current state. The current state is available at the oid sysHighAvailabilityMode.0

item.name: Heartbeats not seen on (interfaces)
item.description: Interfaces on which HA heartbeats are not being seen

item.name: Failover peer's unique identifier
item.description: The unique identifier to represent the failover peer NetScaler

item.name: HA peer IPv4 address
item.description: This represents the ipaddress of the failover peer NetScaler(Only for HA over IPv4). For HA over IPv6 (as well as IPv4) haPeerInetAddr will contain this information.

item.name: HA peer state
item.description: This represents the state of the failover peer NetScaler whether Primary or Secondary

item.name: State transiton time
item.description: This represents the time since the NetScaler underwent a state change from primary to secondary or vice-versa

item.name: Heartbeat packets received
item.description: Number of heartbeat packets received from the peer node. Heartbeats are sent at regular intervals (default is 200 milliseconds) to determine the state of the peer node.

item.name: Heartbeat packets sent
item.description: Number of heartbeat packets sent to the peer node. Heartbeats are sent at regular intervals (default is 200 milliseconds) to determine the state of the peer node.

item.name: Times state changed to FAIL
item.description: Number of times state changed to PARTIAL_FAIL/PARTIAL_FAIL_SSL/ROUTEMONITOR_FAIL/COMPLETE_FAIL.

item.name: HTTP Errors (HTTP500~505)
item.description: Calculated from the total number of HTTP error responses received. Some of the error responses are: 500 Internal Server Error 501 Not Implemented 502 Bad Gateway 503 Service Unavailable 504 Gateway Timeout 505 HTTP Version Not Supported

item.name: HTTP 1.0 Requests
item.description: Calculated from total number of HTTP/1.0 requests received.

item.name: HTTP 1.0 Responses
item.description: Calculated from total number of HTTP/1.0 requests received.

item.name: HTTP 1.1 Requests
item.description: Calculated from total number of HTTP/1.1 requests received.

item.name: HTTP 1.1 Responses
item.description: Calculated from total number of HTTP/1.1 responses sent.

item.name: HTTP Requests
item.description: Calculated from total number of HTTP requests received.

item.name: HTTP Responses
item.description: Calculated from total number of HTTP responses sent.

item.name: SSL Card Status
item.description: Status of the SSL card(s). The value should be interpreted in binary form, with each set bit indicates a card as UP.

item.name: SSL Current Sessions
item.description: Number of active SSL sessions on the NetScaler appliance.

item.name: SSL Decrypted Bytes (delta)
item.description: Calculated from the number of bytes decrypted on the NetScaler appliance.

item.name: SSL Decrypted Bytes (Backend - delta)
item.description: Calculated from the number of bytes decrypted on the back end.

item.name: SSL Decrypted Bytes (Frontend - delta)
item.description: Calculated from the number of bytes decrypted on the front end.

item.name: SSL Encrypted Bytes (delta)
item.description: Calculated from the number of bytes encrypted on the NetScaler appliance.

item.name: SSL Encrypted Bytes (Frontend - delta)
item.description: Calculated from the number of bytes encrypted on the front end.

item.name: SSL Transactions (delta)
item.description: Calculated transactions per second from the number of SSL transactions on the NetScaler appliance.

item.name: SSL v2 Sessions (delta)
item.description: Calculated from the number of SSLv2 sessions on the NetScaler appliance.

item.name: SSL v2 Transactions (delta)
item.description: Calculated from the number of SSLv2 transactions on the NetScaler appliance.

item.name: SSL v3 Sessions (delta)
item.description: Calculated from the number of SSLv3 sessions on the NetScaler appliance.

item.name: SSL v3 Transactions (delta)
item.description: Calculated from the total number of SSLv3 transactions on the NetScaler appliance.

item.name: SSL v1 Sessions (delta)
item.description: Calculated from number of TLSv1 sessions on the NetScaler appliance.

item.name: SSL v1 Transactions (delta)
item.description: Calculated transactions per second from the total number of SSLv1 transactions on the NetScaler appliance.

item.name: SSL Engine Status
item.description: State of the SSL Engine (1=UP/0=DOWN). This state is decided based on SSL Feature/License status and minimum number of cards UP.

item.name: SSL Sessions/s
item.description: SSL sessions per second between client and NetScaler appliance.

item.name: SSL Encrypted Bytes (Backend - delta)
item.description: Calculated from the number of bytes encrypted on the back end.

item.name: SSL Total Sessions
item.description: Number of SSL sessions on the NetScaler appliance.

item.name: SSL Total Transactions
item.description: Number of SSL transactions on the NetScaler appliance.

item.name: TCP Active Server Connections
item.description: Connections to a server currently responding to requests.

item.name: TCP Current Client Connections
item.description: Client connections, including connections in the Opening, Established, and Closing state.

item.name: TCP Current Server Connections
item.description: Server connections, including connections in the Opening, Established, and Closing state.

item.name: TCP Checksum Error
item.description: Packets received with a TCP checksum error.

item.name: TCP Spare connections
item.description: Spare connections available. To save time and resources in establishing another connection for a new client, the connection on the server is not closed after completing the request from the first client and is available for serving future requests.

item.name: TCP Surge Queue Length
item.description: Connections in the surge queue. When the NetScaler cannot open a connection to the server, for example when maximum connections have been reached, the NetScaler queues these requests.

trigger_prototype.name: Very high CPU usage on {HOST.NAME} processor {#SNMPVALUE}

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Type
item_prototype.description: This represents the IP address type

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} VLAN
item_prototype.description: The vlan to which this ip address is bound.

item_prototype.name: {#GROUPNAME} member {#MEMBERNAME} ({#MEMBERIP}:{#MEMBERPORT}) Active Connections
item_prototype.description: Number of connections that are currently active.

item_prototype.name: {#GROUPNAME} member {#MEMBERNAME} ({#MEMBERIP}:{#MEMBERPORT}) Avg Transaction Time
item_prototype.description: Average transaction time in microseconds between netscaler and the service behind it.

item_prototype.name: {#GROUPNAME} member {#MEMBERNAME} ({#MEMBERIP}:{#MEMBERPORT}) Established Connections
item_prototype.description: Total number of connections in ESTABLISHED state.

item_prototype.name: {#GROUPNAME} member {#MEMBERNAME} ({#MEMBERIP}:{#MEMBERPORT}) Requests Rate
item_prototype.description: Request rate in requests per second for this service or virtual server.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#SNMPVALUE} Dropped RX Packets (delta)
item_prototype.description: Number of inbound packets dropped by the specified interface. Commonly dropped packets are multicast frames, spanning tree BPDUs, packets destined to a MAC not owned by the NetScaler when L2 mode is disabled, or packets tagged for a VLAN that is not bound to the interface. This statistic will increment in most healthy networks at a steady rate regardless of traffic load. If a sharp spike in dropped packets occurs, it generally indicates an issue with connected L2 switches, such as a forwarding database overflow resulting in packets being broadcast on all ports.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#SNMPVALUE} Dropped TX Packets (delta)
item_prototype.description: Number of packets dropped in transmission by the specified interface due to one of the following reasons. (1) VLAN mismatch. (2) Oversized packets. (3) Interface congestion. (4) Loopback packets sent on non loop back interface.

item_prototype.name: Packets dropped on {#SNMPVALUE} due to license limit
item_prototype.description: Number of packets dropped due to license limit on the specified interface.

graph_prototype.name: Interface {#SNMPVALUE} packets (in packets per second - pps)

trigger_prototype.name: Operational status was changed on {HOST.NAME} interface {#SNMPVALUE}

item_prototype.name: Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} Server Connections
item_prototype.description: Number of current connections to the actual servers behind the virtual server.

item_prototype.name: Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} Total Clients
item_prototype.description: The total number of established client connections.

item_prototype.name: Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} Total Servers
item_prototype.description: Total number of established server connections.

item_prototype.name: Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} RxBytesRate
item_prototype.description: The total number of established client connections.

item_prototype.name: Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} TxBytesRate
item_prototype.description: This represents the response rate in bytes per second for this service/vserver.

trigger_prototype.expression: {GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}<100 and {GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}>0 and ({GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesDown.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesTransToOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUnKnown.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUp.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()})>0
trigger_prototype.name: vServer {#SNMPVALUE} services are degraded: {ITEM.VALUE1}

trigger_prototype.expression: {GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}=0 and ({GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesDown.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesTransToOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUnKnown.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUp.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()})>0
trigger_prototype.name: vServer {#SNMPVALUE} services are down
trigger_prototype.description: All services associated with the vserver are inactive.

trigger.expression: {GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:haCurStatus.last()}=1 and {GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:haTimeofLastStateTransition.last()}<3600
trigger.name: Netscaler has failovered {ITEM.VALUE2} ago

trigger.expression: {GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:haCurStatus.last()}=1 and {GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:haCurState.last()}<>3
trigger.name: Netscaler HA State is not Up

trigger.expression: {GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:haCurStatus.last()}=1 and {GTS-IS Template SNMP NetScaler 10.x:haErrSyncFailure.diff(1h)}=1
trigger.name: Netscaler HA sync error
